column4: hey, i have a question please. I have ubuntu 9.04 installed, and everything was working fine, but i connected my laptop to an external display, so it changed my resolution from 1280x800 to 1027x768, and now, i can't seem to change it back, the resolution 1280x800 just seems to have disappeared. how do i fix this???
what does xrandr say, can you pastebin?
sorry, i'm new to this, what is xrandr??? how do i get it?
xrandr is a tool thats responsible for setting resolutions, open terminal and type xrandr, pastebin the output
copy the text, go to pastebin.com and paste the text, give the link to the post here
what resolution you want it to set to?
pastebin the output of xrandr once again
it says, xrandr: screen cannot be larger than 2048x768 (desired size 1280x800)
i'll brb, it's saying i must log out and log in again
